title: New iOS 9 emojis allow Apple fans to give friends the middle finger - and they're loving it
text:

Apple users are delightedly taking advantage of the opportunity to virtually give friends and enemies the middle finger. 
Starting from midnight last night, iPhone and iPad owners were "finally" given access to an emoji with an unsubtle message. 
The middle finger was introduced in iOS 9 along with a bundle of new emotional icons including a taco, which has a very rude hidden meaning. 
Get in touch with your emojis: Apple's new emotional icons 
Other emojis include a cheese wedge, burrito, hot dog and a popping champagne bottle. 
On Twitter, people were mega-excited about the new icon, which will bring a new level of nastiness to the otherwise anodyne world of emojis. 
It was released at the same time as Facebook announced its own "dislike" button, which will allow people to criticise posts they hate. can't wait to have the iOS9 update, the Middle finger emoji will be my most used emoji. #bestupdateforbitches — carmen gerrard (@itscarmen___) September 16, 2015 can't wait to have the iOS9 update, the Middle finger emoji will be my most used emoji. #bestupdateforbitches — carmen gerrard (@itscarmen___) September 16, 2015 Mannnn we FINALLY got the middle finger emoji...Now the most used emoji EVER #Apple #ios9 .1 — Christopher McIntosh (@iDanceOrDie5678) September 16, 2015 
Earlier this year, Microsoft attempted to jazz up its dowdy image with the introduction of its own middle finger emoji for Windows. 
Microsoft's famously office-orientated operating system beat Apple by allowing its users to employ the controversial icon. Microsoft 
So what exactly does the upstretched middle finger actually mean? 
If you need more information on what exactly it means to "flip someone the bird" using a solitary raised digit, we'd point you to the following description from Emojipedia. 
It wrote: "The symbol is used in some western cultures as a rude or insulting gesture." 
For further explanation, you might turn to the So Solid Crew's Oxide and Neutrino, who sang these lyrics in the chorus to a ditty called Up Middle Finger: 
"Didn't wanna back we, now they beg friend. 
"Up middle finger I show them." 
The So Solid Crew: We would NOT advise you to show them your middle finger 
What they are saying here is that they met a few naysayers along the path to success, who refused to support their efforts to become pop megastars. 
When they started to ride high on the hit parade, the haters came crawling back but neither Mr Oxide nor his business partner Mr Neutrino were interested in building a friendship. 
So they just showed them a middle finger instead. 
In America, showing someone that dreaded digit is called 'flipping the bird'. 
And not even the So Solid Crew can help us explain why that might be.
